definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
component in Chinese characters/archaic variant of 毫[hao2]/archaic variant of 乙[yi3]
China Central Television (CCTV), PRC state TV network

sentences.english: On the grounds of modern emergency medicine, defibrillation has to be performed in combination with CPR.
sentences.chinese: 根据现代急救理念，电除颤必须与心肺复苏联合应用。

sentences.english: The experiment was carried out using a transversally excited flow CO2 laser.
sentences.chinese: 该实验是用横流电激励CO2激光器进行的。

sentences.english: Pressor response was induced by electrical stimulation of the hypothalamic defence area.
sentences.chinese: 电刺激下丘脑“防御反应区”诱发升压反应。

sentences.english: I also like that the tech is supposed to be durable, reducing e-waste.
sentences.chinese: 另外，这项技术是可持续耐用的，能减少电损耗。

sentences.english: The electrical characteristics and the temperature characteristics of the variode are introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介绍变容二极管的电特性和温度特性。

sentences.english: There is an electric cooker in the kitchen , The cooker is blue , It is on the left.
sentences.chinese: 厨房里还有一个电炉子，是蓝色的，放在左边。

sentences.english: Why do Chinese Chuan Denso are direct trade export business?
sentences.chinese: 为什么华川电装做的都是直接贸易出口业务？

sentences.english: We need to put electricity into people's homes and do it cleanly.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要把电引入人民家中，而且要做得干净利索。

sentences.english: Too much times is being spent around the Mr.
sentences.chinese: 在电煮咖啡机旁花了太多的时间。

sentences.english: The first posts are used for electrical connection and are made of copper according to an embodiment.
sentences.chinese: 所述多个第一柱用于电连接且根据实施例由铜制成。

sentences.english: The solubility of the resin depends on the critical balance of positively and negatively charged ions.
sentences.chinese: 树脂的溶解性取决于阴，阳离子的电平衡。

sentences.english: The passenger carrying capacity of a tramcar is nominal figure listed in gazette schedules.
sentences.chinese: 电車的载客量是宪报刊登的名义上數字。

sentences.english: The government gave him his first patent on an electric device he called an Electrographic Vote Recorder.
sentences.chinese: 政府为他的电记录计票器颁发了第一个专利。

sentences.english: But electrical discharges made by fish are easier to study than the electricity in the brain.
sentences.chinese: 但鱼的放电现象比人类大脑中的电更容易研究。

sentences.english: Don't accelerate too slowly in hybrid and keep batteries charged
sentences.chinese: 混合动力车加速不要过慢，保持电池在充满电状态。

sentences.english: The problem with these early prototypes is they have a very low light-to-electricity conversion rate.
sentences.chinese: 雏形太阳能电池的问题在于光到电的转换率太低。

definition: quantity of electric charge or current
to generate electricity/to send a telegram
to recharge (a battery)/(fig.) to recharge one's batteries (through leisure)/to update one's skills and knowledge
fuel gas (coal gas, natural gas, methane etc)
